headline: Three Pepper Pasta Salad
description: Orange, yellow, and red peppers are tossed with an olive oil and vinegar dressing and tricolor pasta.
name: Three Pepper Pasta Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Place pasta in the pot, cook for 8 to 10 minutes, until al dente, and drain.
In a blender or food processor, blend the olive oil, white wine vinegar, basil, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper until smooth.
In a large bowl, toss together the cooked pasta, dressing mixture, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, orange bell pepper, tomato, and olives. Top with mozzarella cheese to serve.

review.reviewBody: Very good, although I omitted the olives and served cold. The dressing was very light and delicious- however it seemed to need more or a binding agent to the pasta. Next time I will add more parmesian cheese, which would hopefully do the trick. Definately going to use this recipe again!
I added 30ml Mayonaise as a binding agent

I have been making this pasta salad for years, but usually don't write reviews. After reading the reviews I felt it my duty to review this excellent recipe. I was confused about "not enough dressing" and "dressing not favorable enough" comments. The trick to this salad is to serve at room temp or slightly chilled. Give it a try, believe me it works wonders. I also use fresh mozzarella. Depending on pepper sizes I eyeball the noodle to peppers ratio. Enjoy!

Fabulous. my wife had seconds. Then she had thirds. Before you know it, that's all she ate for lunch. I thought the dressing might have the binding issue mentioned above, so I tossed in a spoon of mayonnaise. That was a good idea. 

It's hard to find mozzarella close by so I used Pepper Jack cheese cubes, which gave it a nice little zing. Also my regular tomatoes were not as ripe as my cherry tomatoes so I cut those up instead. 

I can see playing around with this recipe in the future -- maybe throw in some bacon bits? maybe mince a half of a serrano pepper? maybe a fresh parsley or cilantro garnish? maybe a diced hard boiled egg? Lots of flexible possibilities with this recipe.
Really yummy! The whole family loved it! Great ratio, but I tripled the tomatoes.

Easy. Tasty. 
Perfect for pot luck picnics. 
No mayo. No eggs. Yay! 

I only had a yellow pepper so I added diced broccoli stems for green color. The broccoli stems were frozen but easy to dice. I was going to parboil in pasta water after dicing . Turns out freezing and dicing left a nice texture when defrosted so I just stirred diced broccoli into the bowl with the drained hot pasta. It helped cool the pasta quicker. 

I had chopper out for cheese and used it on the olives. I will not do that again. It just wasn't attractive. 

Orange bell pepper plus whole black olives would make this a great Halloween treat. 

I used balsamic vinegar and added more garlic and pepper because I like those flavors.

Excellent recipe and the fresh basil dressing really differentiates it from regular pasta salad with Italian dressing. Some reviewers have said not to skimp on the dressing but we had the opposite issue - pools of dressing in the bottom of the bowl. My body did not react well *cough* to that amount of oil, so we'll probably cut it in half next time. Otherwise, really great salad.
Oh! I also used pene pasta since I was out of tri-color. Was yummy!

I used a bottled Greek Olive dressing (Aldi) and added a little oil, cider vinegar and sugar. This turned out great! So easy. I used a 12-oz bag of bow-tie pasta, and it served a lot more than 8 people. Throw in some pepperoni or salami and it would be a main-dish salad.
Set the black olives aside since the wife is not a fan of them.
